page.title: 02 BRYNTEG/SOUTHSEA(I)
page.content:
{ LOCAL HISTORY
The villages of Brynteg and Southsea are situated on high ground approx_ imatly three miles west of Wrexham town centre.The villages grew up around coal mining,quarrying and the steel industry.The mines have closed and there is little industry left now except the nearby Brymbo Steel_ works which itself has greatly redu_ ced it's workforce over recent years due to modernisation. {HOUSING Brynteg is mainly privatly owned housing characterised by a hotchpotch pattern of older,smoke blackened,sand_ stone terraces,divided by narrow lanes and back alleys.A large Council estate with both brick and steel houses spre_ ads between Brynteg and the oringanal village of Southsea.
